data.title: Elizabeth Barrow to Be Wed To Glenn A. Wagner in April
data.text:
COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Jan. 7—Mr. and Mrs. Donald Fraser Barrow have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Bruen Barrow, to Glenn Arthur Wagner. He is the son of Jean Irwin Wagner of Huntington and the late Mrs. Wagner.

The couple have made plans to be married here in April in St. John's Episcopal Church.

Miss Barrow, a descendant of John Jay, first Chief Jus tice of the United States, is a granddaughter of the late Archibald C. Barrow of New York and Dornoch, Scotland, who was private secretary to Mrs. Andrew Carnegie, and of the late Alexander Jay Bruen, New York lawyer.

A member of Junior As semblies, she made her de but in 1967 at a dinner dance given by her parents at the Plaza Hotel in New York, and was presented at the International Debutante Ball. She was graduated from the Oldfields School in Glencoe, Md., and attended the C. W. Post College in Brookville.

Miss Barrow's father, who retired from the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), is with the Travel Bureau, Inc., in New York. Her fiancé's father is a nuclear scientist with the Brookhaven Na tional Laboratories of the United States Atomic Energy Commission.
